divs: Sighting Detailsi was standing in a car park in the town center with a friend when my friend noticed something high up in the sky and pointed it out to me. the sky was very clear with only a small amount of whispy thin clouds dotted about the sky , visability was excellent , my friend pointed to a very bright shinning object that was stationary and making no sound at all, i cant be exact of the height of the object but it was approximatly at a 60 degrees angle from the ground and we were facing roughly north to north east . at first it looked like a very bright star but having never seen a star during full daylight and to be honest i dont know if it is possible to see a star in daylight, i dissmissed the star idea , my friend sugested it may be a satalight in very low orbit but we had been observing it for over 3 minutes and it had not moved , then a small thin cloud moved towards it then passed behind it , the cloud was definatly at a higher altitude than the object so then i relised it was no satalight and was definatly now not a star , because the sun was shining so brightly even though it was behind me it was still hurting my eyes staring up at this object so i went into my car to grab my sunglasses , i then remberd i had a pair of small binoclears in my glove box, i grabbed them and went back to my friend who was still watching the object , id say over 5 minutes had passed and the object still had bnot moved . quickly i focused in the binos on the object and was totally amased at what i saw , i had the focus perfect and could see it very very clearly , the object was an absolutly perfect sphere , white in colour with no markings what so ever , i could clearly see the sun reflecting on the upper left side of the sphere and it was slowly rotating in a clockwise direction , i watched for a moinute or so then passed the binoclears to my friend who watched the object for a short time then handed them back to me , as i watched again in amasment at this strange object it just suddenly vanished before my eyes , one second it was there next it was gone , no movement left ,right or up or down just totally stationary in one spot although it was rotating , then just vanished , this whole thing lasted about 15 minutes but it could have been there much longer before my friend noticed it . after it was gone i observed 4 passenger jet aircraft pass over the same part of the sky at the same 60 degrees angle , i looked at the air craft through the binoclears so to get some reference as to the size of the sphere , as the passenger jets were flying at aproximatly the same altitude as the sphere , i estimate the sphere to be at least 40 feet in diameter or more , roughly speaking 40 to 60 feet in diameter , i have seen weather balloons and this was not one of them , through the binoclears my view was excellent, the fact that it simply just vanished was the most impresive thing for me. this sphere was very mutch within range of newcastle airport and i feel sure they must have saw it on there radar.
